TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class Transition : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, Java.Lang.ICloneable

.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit Transition extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.Lang.ICloneable, class System.IDisposable
Public MustInherit Class Transition Inherits Object Implements ICloneable, IDisposable, IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: A Transition holds information about animations that will be run on its targets during a scene change.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: A View on which the Transition will act, must be non-null.
Docs.summary: Sets the target view instances that this Transition is interested in animating.
Docs.returns: The Transition to which the target is added. Returning the same object makes it easier to chain calls during construction, such as transitionSet.addTransitions(new Fade()).addTarget(someView);

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: The type to include when running this transition.
Docs.summary: Adds the Class of a target view that this Transition is interested in animating.
Docs.returns: The Transition to which the target class was added. Returning the same object makes it easier to chain calls during construction, such as transitionSet.addTransitions(new Fade()).addTarget(ImageView.class);

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void CaptureEndValues (Android.Transitions.TransitionValues? transitionValues);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CaptureEndValues(class Android.Transitions.TransitionValues transitionValues) cil managed
Public MustOverride Sub CaptureEndValues (transitionValues As TransitionValues)
public: abstract void CaptureEndValues(Android::Transitions::TransitionValues ^ transitionValues);
abstract member CaptureEndValues : Android.Transitions.TransitionValues -> unit

Docs.param: The holder for any values that the Transition wishes to store. Values are stored in the values field of this TransitionValues object and are keyed from a String value. For example, to store a view's rotation value, a transition might call transitionValues.values.put("appname:transitionname:rotation", view.getRotation()). The target view will already be stored in the transitionValues structure when this method is called.
Docs.summary: Captures the values in the end scene for the properties that this transition monitors.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: The root of the transition hierarchy.
The values for a specific target in the start scene.
The values for the target in the end scene.
Docs.summary: This method creates an animation that will be run for this transition given the information in the startValues and endValues structures captured earlier for the start and end scenes.
Docs.returns: A Animator to be started at the appropriate time in the overall transition for this scene change. A null value means no animation should be run.

Docs.param: The target view, must be non-null.
Docs.summary: Removes the given target from the list of targets that this Transition is interested in animating.
Docs.returns: Transition The Transition from which the target is removed. Returning the same object makes it easier to chain calls during construction, such as transitionSet.addTransitions(new Fade()).removeTarget(someView);
